channel.title: Languages
channel.description:
Id like to know the languages you all speak, any languages you wanted to learn, any languages you have successfully/currently learned (and the difficulty & experience), how you're learning them, and what about the language you enjoy most.
Just a little info I want to collect

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

dutch (flemish) and a bit english lol
i tried learning italian (cuz i’m part italian) but f that

Read full topic

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I speak American fluently.

Uhh, I used to speak spanish but I quit cus American is a better language.

Read full topic

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:56, topic:445149”][quote author=Frell link=topic=547838.msg4017981#msg4017981 date=1339791986]
Most sweds speak english lol, same with Norwegians. Finding english speakers there isn’t uncommon at all from what ive heard :S
[/quote]

most speak it pretty well, some have a lot of trouble with it

I’m going back there for a 3rd year next year, being able to read basic shit like where I am would help immensely[/quote]
Im actually also considering learning Swedish. My goal was Norwegian but its becoming near impossible because theres so many dialects that pronounce everything so different, while Swedish is near the same but more standardized and easier to listen to.

Not sure yet, Id just love to learn another language and thats all I know

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

Most sweds speak english lol, same with Norwegians. Finding english speakers there isn’t uncommon at all from what ive heard :S

most speak it pretty well, some have a lot of trouble with it

I’m going back there for a 3rd year next year, being able to read basic shit like where I am would help immensely

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:41, topic:445149”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=547838.msg4017899#msg4017899 date=1339784911]

My first language is English, I can speak German enough to have a conversation with someone from Germany.

I also speak Dari, the most widely used language of Afghanistan. It’s a variation of Persian, I can’t write it because it’s just too difficult to learn it. When Dari is written in Dari it looks like this - درى. You can make the words into English though, which is what I do. For example “Hello” in Dari is “Salam” but when it’s written in the language it looks a lot different than that.

Its more like Hi, considering your missing out the full word. No idea how you spell it but it’d be As Salam O Ley Kum, js.
[/quote]

You speak Dari? First person on an RSPS community that I’ve met who actually knows what it is.[/quote]
Nope, I can speak Urdu though and their pretty similar. ah;p, they speak that in Dubai I believe cause my friend speaks it and he comes from Dubai. I thought it was quite odd how we both live in Scotland too haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Frell:

Most sweds speak english lol, same with Norwegians. Finding english speakers there isn’t uncommon at all from what ive heard :S

When I was sent over to Sweden to write up some plans for a turbine and review a site, their English was absolutely flawless, you could barely detect their accent, it was only on some words that you could hear a Swedish tone. I was really surprised haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Most sweds speak english lol, same with Norwegians. Finding english speakers there isn’t uncommon at all from what ive heard :S

Read full topic

item.title: Languages
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I only speak English, am probably going to try to learn Swedish within a year but I doubt I’ll get very far

I’d love to learn German and Japanese if I had the time, both are pretty practical too

Some completely useless languages I’d like to learn: Cornish, a Frisian dialect

Arabic is another language I’d love to learn but I ain’t touching that one with a 10 foot pole, probably worse to learn than Japanese

Frell:

Whys german so appealing to you guys other than listening to his speeches and understanding Mein Kampf

German is a real guttural language and I like that, I also like the way Japanese can be spoken really gutturally as well (see: any Japanese movie with an old angry guy)

Read full topic

item.description:

Irish
[/quote]You mean gaylick?

ye men, i spek gud geylick!

I can speak very small amounts of Gaelic, although I’m not sure if Scottish Gaelic is different from Irish Gaelic.
[/quote]Scottish gaylick just has a more interesting accent :P[/quote]
Scottish accents are the future of all man kind :|.

Read full topic

My first language is English, I can speak German enough to have a conversation with someone from Germany.

I also speak Dari, the most widely used language of Afghanistan. It’s a variation of Persian, I can’t write it because it’s just too difficult to learn it. For example “Hello” in Dari is “Salam” but when it’s written in the language it looks a lot different than that.
[/quote]
